author: smsimeonov
body:
This works fine with PSSession cmdlets as explained [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/learn/remoting/wsman-remoting-in-powershell-core?view=powershell-6) but it doesn't seem to work for CIM cmdlets

# Steps to reproduce

```
$SSO = New-CimSessionOption -UseSsl -SkipCACheck -SkipCNCheck
$SS = New-CimSession -ComputerName $TARGET -SessionOption $SSO -Credential $CREDS -Authentication Negotiate -Port 5986
```

# Expected behavior

It connects as normal.

# Actual behavior

```
New-CimSession : The client cannot connect to the destination specified in the request. Verify that the service on the destination is running and is accepting requests. Consult the logs and documentation for the WS-Management service running on the destination, most commonly IIS or WinRM. If the destination is the WinRM service, run the following command on the destination to analyze and configure the WinRM service: "winrm quickconfig".
At line:1 char:7
+ $SS = New-CimSession -ComputerName $TARGET -SessionOption $SSO -Crede ...
+       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ConnectionError: (:) [New-CimSession], CimException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : HRESULT 0x80338012,Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimCmdlets.NewCimSessionCommand
+ PSComputerName        : $TARGET
```

# Environment data

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: Configuration option when using CIM cmdlets
